column4: hi
i need to find user's LANG while logged in as root
there command i am using is this " su "username" -c env | grep LANG
but this does'nt work on ubuntu
the command i am using is this " su "username" -c env | grep LANG
its returning english
where as user's lang is german
let me try
i am already root so dont need to sudo it
Why do you want to do this?  What's your end-goal?
why shouldn't it work on ubuntu?
I don't understand what you mean by "username"'s LANG.  What if the user changes it after logging in?
what if it's different between terminals?
no, what if he sets a different lang in GDM for instance... That won't be reflected in what you get with your su command
then you already have your answer.  Use the su command
yes it is.
have you changed root's lang and verified?
you are running: su - USERNAME -c 'env | grep LANG'  ?
you haven't answered my qusetion
your command is returing null
well there you go
